market_summary: Risk-off tape in mega-cap growth: sharp 1M drawdowns visible across AMZN (242.60->199.60), MSFT (470.67->401.84), META (631.09->649.81 but off late-Jan peak), and semis choppy (NVDA 185.81->186.94; SMH 391.53->406.11).
Gold saw a sharp 1-day selloff (GLD -3.28% on 2026-02-12; IAU -2.88%), after a highly volatile late-Jan surge/flush (GLD 494.56 on 2026-01-28 to 444.95 on 2026-01-30).
Crypto remains volatile; BTC-USD down materially over ~1M (91188 on 2026-01-12 to 66176 on 2026-02-12), mirrored by IBIT (53.57->37.05).

thesis_damage_flags.why: High recent volatility and negative-leaning headline risk around obesity market competition (news: Wegovy vial launch to counter LLY; recent price drawdown 58.93 on 2026-02-02 to 48.93 on 2026-02-12).
Short-term momentum deterioration: -3.28% day move on 2026-02-12 and large late-Jan whipsaw (494.56 on 2026-01-28 to 451.39 on 2026-02-12).
Crypto beta risk elevated: IBIT fell from 53.57 (2026-01-13 close) to 37.05 (2026-02-12 snapshot), consistent with BTC-USD weakness.

thesis: Quality/defensive earnings profile supported by strong TTM profitability: operating income 10.65B on revenue 280.39B (TTM) and positive free cash flow 9.003B (TTM).
Relative price strength vs many growth peers over the past month: COST rose from 941.93 (2026-01-13 close) to 998.86 (2026-02-12 snapshot).
Diversifies factor and sector exposure away from concentrated mega-cap tech while staying large-cap and liquid (sector: Consumer Staples; market cap ~434.2B).
risks: Multiple compression risk if market rotates away from defensive/staples; valuation multiples were not verifiable in this run (UNKNOWN).
Margin sensitivity to wage/transportation and shrink; low-margin model means small cost shifts can move earnings.
Event risk around near-term catalysts (e.g., upcoming earnings dates not verifiable from tools in this run: UNKNOWN).
falsifiable_checks: If trailing 30-day price breaks down materially vs entry range (e.g., sustained move below the late-Jan lows around 940 region on daily data), the momentum leg is failing.
If next reported cash flow update shows material deterioration in operating cash flow/FCF versus the latest TTM (OCF 14.763B; FCF 9.003B), the quality signal is weakening.
trade_of_the_day.why_now: Over the next 6–18 months, a staples compounder with consistent cash generation can act as a ballast if growth remains volatile; the last month’s price action shows COST holding up and advancing while several mega-cap growth names saw pronounced drawdowns.

constraints_check.notes: 8 positions; weights sum to 100. Max single position 16% (<=40). Sector weights: Information Technology 42% (MSFT+NVDA+TSM), Communication Services 14%, Consumer Staples 14%, Energy 10%, Industrials 10%, Crypto 10% (<=10). No broad index ETFs used.
